subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The former Chicago Bears tackle Tank Johnson will not face charges connected to his arrest in Gilbert, Ariz., a Phoenix suburb, on suspicion of driving under the influence. The police said the case would be closed with no request for prosecution. Johnson was arrested June 22 after an officer pulled him over for speeding. He was released without charges. Test results Monday showed Johnson’s blood alcohol level was .072, under the presumptive limit for D.U.I. in Arizona of .08 percent.
